verses.kjv: Behold, the LORD maketh the earth empty, and maketh it waste, and turneth it upside down, and scattereth abroad the inhabitants thereof.
verses.ct: Look — the LORD is about to devastate the earth, lay it waste, twist its surface, and scatter its people in every direction.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, as with the people, so with the priest; as with the servant, so with his master; as with the maid, so with her mistress; as with the buyer, so with the seller; as with the lender, so with the borrower; as with the taker of usury, so with the giver of usury to him.
verses.ct: Everyone will share the same fate — priest and common person alike, servant and master, maid and mistress, buyer and seller, lender and borrower, creditor and debtor.

verses.kjv: The land shall be utterly emptied, and utterly spoiled: for the LORD hath spoken this word.
verses.ct: The land will be completely emptied and thoroughly plundered, because the LORD has declared it.

verses.kjv: The earth mourneth and fadeth away, the world languisheth and fadeth away, the haughty people of the earth do languish.
verses.ct: The earth grieves and withers away, the world weakens and withers away, and the proud people of the earth grow feeble.

verses.kjv: The earth also is defiled under the inhabitants thereof; because they have transgressed the laws, changed the ordinance, broken the everlasting covenant.
verses.ct: The earth has been polluted by those living on it, because they have violated the laws, disregarded the statutes, and broken the everlasting covenant.

verses.kjv: Therefore hath the curse devoured the earth, and they that dwell therein are desolate: therefore the inhabitants of the earth are burned, and few men left.
verses.ct: For this reason, a curse is consuming the earth, and its inhabitants suffer the consequences. The people of the earth are scorched, and only a few survive.

verses.kjv: The new wine mourneth, the vine languisheth, all the merryhearted do sigh.
verses.ct: The fresh wine dries up, the grapevine withers, and all who once celebrated now groan.

verses.kjv: The mirth of tabrets ceaseth, the noise of them that rejoice endeth, the joy of the harp ceaseth.
verses.ct: The joyful sound of tambourines has stopped, the noise of celebration has ended, and the music of the harp has gone silent.

verses.kjv: They shall not drink wine with a song; strong drink shall be bitter to them that drink it.
verses.ct: No one drinks wine with singing anymore; alcohol tastes bitter to those who drink it.

verses.kjv: The city of confusion is broken down: every house is shut up, that no man may come in.
verses.ct: The chaotic city lies in ruins; every house is boarded up so no one can enter.

verses.kjv: There is a crying for wine in the streets; all joy is darkened, the mirth of the land is gone.
verses.ct: People cry out in the streets for wine; all happiness has turned to darkness, and the joy of the land has vanished.

verses.kjv: In the city is left desolation, and the gate is smitten with destruction.
verses.ct: Nothing remains in the city but devastation, and the gate has been battered to pieces.

verses.kjv: When thus it shall be in the midst of the land among the people, there shall be as the shaking of an olive tree, and as the gleaning grapes when the vintage is done.
verses.ct: This is how it will be across the earth among the nations — like the last olives shaken from a tree, like the few grapes left after the harvest is over.

verses.kjv: They shall lift up their voice, they shall sing for the majesty of the LORD, they shall cry aloud from the sea.
verses.ct: Those who remain will raise their voices and shout for joy. From the west they will proclaim the majesty of the LORD.

verses.kjv: Wherefore glorify ye the LORD in the fires, even the name of the LORD God of Israel in the isles of the sea.
verses.ct: Therefore, honor the LORD in the east, and praise the name of the LORD, the God of Israel, in the coastlands of the sea.

verses.kjv: From the uttermost part of the earth have we heard songs, even glory to the righteous. But I said, My leanness, my leanness, woe unto me! the treacherous dealers have dealt treacherously; yea, the treacherous dealers have dealt very treacherously.
verses.ct: From the farthest edges of the earth we have heard songs declaring, 'Glory to the Righteous One!' But I said, 'I am wasting away, I am wasting away! How terrible for me! The traitors continue to betray — the traitors deal in utter treachery!'

verses.kjv: Fear, and the pit, and the snare, are upon thee, O inhabitant of the earth.
verses.ct: Terror, the pit, and the trap await you, people of the earth.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that he who fleeth from the noise of the fear shall fall into the pit; and he that cometh up out of the midst of the pit shall be taken in the snare: for the windows from on high are open, and the foundations of the earth do shake.
verses.ct: Whoever runs from the sound of terror will fall into the pit, and whoever climbs out of the pit will be caught in the trap. The floodgates of heaven are thrown open, and the foundations of the earth are shaking.

verses.kjv: The earth is utterly broken down, the earth is clean dissolved, the earth is moved exceedingly.
verses.ct: The earth is completely shattered, the earth is split apart, the earth is violently shaken.

verses.kjv: The earth shall reel to and fro like a drunkard, and shall be removed like a cottage; and the transgression thereof shall be heavy upon it; and it shall fall, and not rise again.
verses.ct: The earth will stagger like a drunk and sway like a hut in the wind. Its sin weighs so heavily on it that it will collapse and never get up again.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the LORD shall punish the host of the high ones that are on high, and the kings of the earth upon the earth.
verses.ct: On that day, the LORD will punish the powerful forces in the heavens above and the kings of the earth below.

verses.kjv: And they shall be gathered together, as prisoners are gathered in the pit, and shall be shut up in the prison, and after many days shall they be visited.
verses.ct: They will be rounded up together like prisoners thrown into a dungeon. They will be locked away in confinement, and after a long time, they will be called to account.

verses.kjv: Then the moon shall be confounded, and the sun ashamed, when the LORD of hosts shall reign in mount Zion, and in Jerusalem, and before his ancients gloriously.
verses.ct: Then the moon will be humiliated and the sun will be put to shame, because the LORD of Hosts will reign on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, displaying his glory in the presence of the elders.
